metadata.description: Comprehensive test specification for T004: Contract test GET /api/quotes endpoint with TDD validation and MCP browser verification

T004.title: Contract Test GET /api/quotes
T004.description: Execute contract tests for GET /api/quotes endpoint and validate API responses. This task validates the quote list endpoint implementation against the API contract specification, including response structure, pagination, filtering, and error handling. Expected to be in TDD red phase initially.

successConditions.description: Test suite executes successfully (TDD allows test failures)
No ESLint errors (per validation policy BLOCK_ON_ERRORS_ONLY)
API responds with valid HTTP status

failureConditions.description: Dev server failed to start (blocks execution)
TypeScript errors present (blocks execution per BLOCK_ON_ERRORS_ALWAYS)

likelyFailures.suggestedFix: Implement GET /api/v1/quotes endpoint with pagination, filtering, and sorting support
Update API response to match contract specification with quotes array, pagination object, and appliedFilters
Add pagination logic to API endpoint with page, pageSize, totalCount, hasMore, and nextCursor
Add validation for page, pageSize, filters, and sortBy parameters with appropriate error responses

json.title: CODOR Test Task Specification Schema v2.0.0
json.description: Authoritative schema for agent-generated test task specifications (v2.0.0, updated 2025-09-30). This schema enforces compliance with the Script-Based Testing Framework and ensures all test tasks are executable by the script-execution-engine without agent involvement.

generatedAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when specification was generated

generatedBy.description: Agent or system that generated this specification

description.description: High-level description of what this test suite validates

workspaceRoot.description: Absolute path to workspace root directory

evidenceDirectory.description: Directory where evidence will be collected (relative to workspace root)

devServer.description: Development server configuration if required for tests

command.description: Command to start dev server (e.g., 'npm run dev')

workingDirectory.description: Absolute path where dev server command should run

healthCheckUrl.description: URL to check if server is ready

startupTimeout.description: Maximum time to wait for server startup (milliseconds)

port.description: Port the dev server listens on

environment.description: Global environment variables for all test executions

timeout.description: Global timeout for entire test suite execution (milliseconds)

validationPolicy.description: Configurable policies for validation tool failures (linting, type checking, etc.)

availableActionTypes.description: Action types available in this test suite

tasks.description: Test tasks indexed by task ID

technicalDebtConfiguration.description: Configuration for technical debt generation from test failures

enabled.description: Enable automatic technical debt generation from test failures

routingStrategy.description: Strategy for routing debt to sprint tasks or inventory

sprintTasksMaxItems.description: Maximum number of tasks in sprint before routing to inventory

sprintTasksMaxCritical.description: Maximum number of CRITICAL items in sprint

title.description: Clear, concise task title describing what is being tested

description.description: Detailed description of what this task validates and why

dependencies.description: Task IDs that must complete before this task can run

prerequisites.description: Actions that must be completed before test execution

cleanup.description: Cleanup actions to run after test execution

description.description: Clear description of what this action does

parameters.description: Action-specific parameters (validated by action type schema)

evidenceCapture.description: What evidence to capture for this action

retryAttempts.description: Number of retry attempts on failure

continueOnFailure.description: Continue execution even if this action fails

command.description: Exact command to execute (e.g., 'npm test -- path/to/test.ts')

workingDirectory.description: Absolute path where command should execute

shell.description: Shell to use for command execution

script.description: JavaScript to evaluate in browser context

url.description: Full URL for the HTTP request

body.description: Request body (object for JSON, string for others)

jsonSchema.description: JSON schema to validate response body

containsText.description: Text that must appear in response body

matchesRegex.description: Regex pattern that response must match

connectionString.description: Database connection string (use environment variable references for credentials)

query.description: SQL or NoSQL query to execute

rowSchema.description: JSON schema for validating row structure

containsValues.description: Values that must appear in results

filePath.description: Absolute path to file to validate

contentRegex.description: Regex pattern file content must match

schema.description: JSON schema for validating file content (for SCHEMA_VALID)

successConditions.description: Conditions that must be met for test to pass

description.description: Human-readable description of what this condition validates

TechnicalDebtExpectations.description: Expected technical debt items if tests fail

likelyFailures.description: Likely failure scenarios and their causes

suggestedFix.description: Suggested approach to fix this issue

allStepsMustPass.description: All test steps must pass for task completion

minimumPassRate.description: Minimum percentage of steps that must pass (if allStepsMustPass is false)

requiredEvidence.description: Evidence files that must be generated

taskStatusLock.description: Task status is locked by script and cannot be modified by agent

prerequisites.description: Prerequisites that must be satisfied before execution

checkCommand.description: Command to verify prerequisite is met

executionOrder.description: Ordered list of action IDs to execute

parallelExecution.description: Allow parallel execution of independent actions

scriptDirectory.description: Directory where custom scripts are located

allowedDirectories.description: Directories where file validation is permitted

LintToolPolicy.description: Policy configuration for a linting tool

enabled.description: Whether this linting tool is enabled

blockOn.description: When to block execution based on linting results

treatWarningsAsErrors.description: Treat all warnings as errors (equivalent to ERRORS_AND_WARNINGS)

maxWarnings.description: Maximum number of warnings allowed before blocking (null = unlimited)

ignoredRules.description: List of rule IDs to ignore

errorOnRules.description: List of rule IDs that should always be treated as errors

TypeCheckToolPolicy.description: Policy configuration for a type checking tool

enabled.description: Whether this type checking tool is enabled

blockOn.description: When to block execution based on type checking results

parameters.command: Write-Host ' T004 infrastructure validated!' -ForegroundColor Green; Write-Host 'Ready for full contract test execution' -ForegroundColor Cyan

data.command: Write-Host ' T004 infrastructure validated!' -ForegroundColor Green; Write-Host 'Ready for full contract test execution' -ForegroundColor Cyan
data.stdout:
? T004 infrastructure validated!
Ready for full contract test execution
